knowledge.title: Customer Retention Guidelines
knowledge.excerpt: Strategies for retaining customers considering cancellation due to competitor pricing.
knowledge.fullContent:
Customer Retention Guidelines

1. UNDERSTAND THE SITUATION:
- Ask about competitor and their quote
- Don't be defensive about pricing
- Acknowledge their concern

2. LOYALTY DISCOUNTS:
- 5+ years: 8% discount
- 8+ years: 12% discount
- 10+ years: 15% discount

3. BUNDLE OPPORTUNITIES:
- Home + Auto: 20% discount on both
- Home + Auto + Umbrella: 25% discount
- Always check if customer has other policies elsewhere

4. RETENTION PRIORITY:
- High: 5+ year customers, good payment history
- Medium: 2-5 year customers
- Standard: New customers (<2 years)
knowledge.question: How should I handle a customer wanting to cancel due to competitor pricing?
knowledge.answer: First, understand their situation by asking about the competitor quote without being defensive. Then offer loyalty discounts (8% for 5+ years, 12% for 8+ years, 15% for 10+ years) and explore bundle opportunities (20% off for Home + Auto). Always check if they have other policies elsewhere that could be bundled.

knowledge.title: Bundle Discount Structure
knowledge.excerpt: Complete guide to multi-policy bundle discounts and savings.
knowledge.fullContent:
Bundle Discount Structure

HOME + AUTO BUNDLE:
- 20% discount on both policies
- Single bill and payment date
- One deductible for claims affecting both

HOME + AUTO + UMBRELLA:
- 25% discount on all policies
- Enhanced liability protection

MULTI-VEHICLE DISCOUNT:
- 2 vehicles: 10% additional
- 3+ vehicles: 15% additional

SAVINGS EXAMPLE:
- Home: $1,450 → $1,160 (with bundle)
- Auto 1: $980 → $784
- Auto 2: $1,420 → $1,136
- Total savings: $770/year
knowledge.question: What bundle discounts are available?
knowledge.answer: Home + Auto bundle provides 20% discount on both policies with single billing. Adding Umbrella increases to 25% off all policies. Multi-vehicle discounts add 10% for 2 cars or 15% for 3+ cars. Example: A customer with $1,450 home and two cars ($980 + $1,420) could save $770/year with bundling.

knowledge.title: Electric Vehicle Coverage
knowledge.excerpt: Specialized coverage options for Tesla and other electric vehicles.
knowledge.fullContent:
Electric Vehicle Coverage

BATTERY PROTECTION:
- Covers battery degradation beyond warranty
- Replacement cost coverage up to $15,000
- Cost: $180/year

CHARGING EQUIPMENT:
- Covers home charging station damage
- Includes installation defects
- Coverage up to $2,500
- Cost: $95/year

ROADSIDE ASSISTANCE:
- EV-specific towing to charging stations
- Mobile charging service
- Included with EV policies

OEM PARTS GUARANTEE:
- Tesla-certified repair shops
- Original manufacturer parts only
- No aftermarket substitutions
knowledge.question: What's included in Tesla/EV coverage?
knowledge.answer: EV coverage includes: Battery Protection ($180/year) covering degradation and replacement up to $15,000; Charging Equipment coverage ($95/year) for home charging stations up to $2,500; EV-specific roadside assistance with mobile charging; and OEM Parts Guarantee ensuring Tesla-certified repairs with original parts only.

knowledge.title: Coverage Territory
knowledge.excerpt: Geographic coverage for auto and home policies.
knowledge.fullContent:
Coverage Territory

AUTO POLICIES:
- Full coverage in all 50 US states
- Full coverage in Canada
- Mexico: Requires separate endorsement ($45/trip or $120/year)
- Rental cars covered in US and Canada

HOME POLICIES:
- Property at stated address
- Personal property worldwide (up to 10% of coverage)
- Temporary living expenses if displaced

TRAVEL CONSIDERATIONS:
- Notify us for trips over 30 days
- International rentals may need separate coverage
- Roadside assistance available in US and Canada
knowledge.question: Does auto coverage apply out of state?
knowledge.answer: Yes, SafeGuard auto policies provide full coverage across all 50 US states and Canada. For Mexico travel, a separate endorsement is required ($45/trip or $120/year). Rental cars are covered in US and Canada. For trips over 30 days, customers should notify us.

knowledge.title: Additional Driver Pricing
knowledge.excerpt: Cost to add additional drivers to auto policies.
knowledge.fullContent:
Additional Driver Pricing

STANDARD RATES (per year):
- Economy/Compact: $45/driver
- Mid-size/Sedan: $60/driver
- SUV/Truck: $72/driver
- Luxury/Sports: $95/driver
- Electric Vehicle: $84/driver

SURCHARGES:
- Under 25: +50%
- SR-22 required: +75%
- Recent accidents: +25-50%
- Recent violations: +15-30%

DISCOUNTS:
- Bundle customers: 10% off driver fees
- Good student: 15% off for under-25 drivers
- Defensive driving course: 10% off
knowledge.question: How much does it cost to add additional drivers?
knowledge.answer: Additional driver rates per year: Economy/Compact $45, Mid-size/Sedan $60, SUV/Truck $72, Luxury/Sports $95, Electric Vehicle $84. Surcharges apply for under-25 (+50%), SR-22 (+75%), accidents (+25-50%), violations (+15-30%). Bundle customers get 10% off driver fees. Good students under 25 get 15% off.
